llm: In the chart, it is easy to see that in the year of 1995, there were about 70% of the population in urban areas, and there were only about 35% of people born outside Australia. As time went on, the proportion of Australians who lived in rural areas increased, and those born outside the country increased, which shows that the Australian population has changed. In urban areas, the proportion of Australians fell to about 60%, and the proportion of people born outside Australia rose to about 35%, while in rural areas, the proportion of Australians was only about 45% and the percentage of people born outside the country was only about 36%. The trend in town areas is similar to that in urban areas, and the percentage of Australians fell from about 65% to 65%, and the percentage of foreigners rose from about 15% to about 25%. In rural areas, the percentage of people born in Australia was only about 80% in 1995, and it was only about 75% in 2010. The percentage of foreigners was only about 6% to 8%. The changes may be related to factors such as migration policies, economic opportunities, and lifestyle preferences. In general, the data show that the percentage of foreigners is rising in urban and town areas, while the proportion of Australians in rural areas is relatively stable. It shows that Australia is becoming more and more diversified in terms of its population.

question: The bar chart below gives information about vehicle ownership in China.Write a report for a university lecturer describing the information.
human: The chart describes the data about vehicle ownership in a particular country, China from 1987 to 1999.Overall, the highest vehicle ownership occurred in the year 1999 while the lowest trend was recorded in the year 1987.According to the chart, China has less than 500 vehicle per thousand people during 1987. It is evident that there is an increment in the figures throughout the years. Within the two year interval, the number of vehicle ownership was already at 500. In 1991, 900 vehicle per thousand people were already in possession as depicted in the graph. In between 1991 to 1995, it went up gradually to nearly a thousand. Furthermore, the vehicle ownership doubled in number in 1995. Also, in an unspecified period of time, the number of vehicle possession in that country were approximately 3,000. By the end of year 1999, the numbers rose significantly to 4,100 vehicle per thousand people.
llm: The bar chart shows that in the year 2000 the number of vehicles per thousand people was comparatively low, about 10 per thousand. The graph shows that the number of vehicles per thousand people increased significantly in the following years. In 2005, it was more than doubled, reaching about 25 per thousand. The number has gradually increased and in 2010 it was about 50 per thousand. Compared with this, the number of vehicles per thousand people was greatly increased in the following years. In 2015, the number of vehicles per thousand people more than tripled and reached a high of 120 per thousand. The growth in the number of vehicles can be attributed to the high income of the people, the perfect roads and the various types of vehicles. The bar chart also shows the development of the car industry in China, and the prosperity of the country's economy. The trend in this bar chart is very important to the policy-makers, economists and scholars who study the development of China's economy and the impact on the international automobile industry. The data show that China has been greatly developed and industrialized, and the people's living standards have been greatly improved.

question: The bar chart below shows the number of houses built per year in two cities, Derby and Nottingham, Between 2000 and 2009. Write a report for a university lecturer describing the information shown below.You should write at least 150 words.
human: Information is presented by the bar chart which illustrates the figure for houses built each year in Derby and Nottingham over a ten-year period from 2000 to 2009. Overall, it can be seen that there was a clear trend that houses in Derby were built more than that in Nottingham each year over the survey period, except for the year 2000, 2001 and 2007.Turning to the first main feature, there were just under 50 houses which were constructed in Derby for the first two years between 2000 and 2001, while the number of houses in Nottingham was an exact 50 and a little more than 50 in 2000 and 2001 respectively. The figure for houses in Derby then increased considerably to approximately 75 in 2002, which exceeded the number of houses in Nottingham, and plateaued at more than 100 until 2006. On the contrary, in 2002 the chart depicts a noticeable decline in the number of houses in Nottingham to less than 25. Nevertheless, the number of houses in Nottingham rebounded and rose to around 75 in 2005 before dropping suddenly to nearly zero in 2006.Turning to another main feature, whereas in 2007 the figure for houses in Derby remained unchanged at above 100, the number of houses in Nottingham soared to almost 200, exceeding the number of houses in Derby. The last key feature to point out is that the number of houses in Derby jumped dramatically to nearly 350 by 2009 while the number of houses in Nottingham experienced the third drop to almost zero in 2008 before the number of houses in Nottingham increased dramatically to 250 in 2009.
llm: From the graph it can be seen that in the year 2000, when the houses built in the two cities were compared, there was a significant difference between the two, with 1,200 houses built in Nottingham and only 800 in Derby. At first sight, the numbers of houses built in the two cities show that in all but one year, Derby was building more houses than Nottingham. This trend continued until 2007 when both cities built the same number of houses, 1,400 and 1,000 respectively. It is also interesting to note that from 2007 onwards there is a noticeable decrease in the number of houses built in both cities, with the sharpest drop in the year 2008. In conclusion, the graph shows that in general Nottingham is building more houses than Derby, but this is probably due to the fluctuation of the number of houses being built, which is influenced by external factors such as economic conditions. An analysis of the data could provide valuable information for future housing projects and help with the planning of infrastructure and resource allocation. This information would be of great use to urban planners, local government and property developers who wish to study the housing situation in these two cities.

question: The bar chart below shows the numbers of men and women attending various evening courses at an adult education centre in the year 2009. The pie chart gives information about the ages of these course participants.Write a report for a university, lecturer describing the information shown below.
human: The bar chart shows what are the tendences of men and women in attending evening courses in an adult education centre during 2009 in a scale of 0 to 40 people, while the pie chart shows the percentages of ages of the participants in these courses.Fist of all, the most striking information is that women were largely more present in languages and painting courses than men, and that the vast majority of the participants in the overall courses were 50 years old or over.To begin with, it is clearly demonstrated that there were more women than men in all courses, except in sculture. In fact, men attended to language and drama courses were twice as less than women. Women were 40 in language courses and 20 in drama. Men were also slightly less in paiting, around 25 people, compared to women who were 30 at this course. However, in sculpture, men tended to be more present, as they were 10, which is roughly the double of the number of women who were present.Secondly, there was a marked tendence for people aged from 50 and over to attend a these courses, as they were slighlty more than two fifth. Just over a quarter of the people were between 40 and 49, while those who were 30-39 were just 16%. Finally, the youngest ones were not very present. In fact, the 20-29 years old group represented just 11%, while the under 20 were barely the half, with 5%.To conclude, it can be seen that the vast majority of the people who attended these evening courses were aged from 40 to 50 and over. Moreover, women tended to attend much more at all courses than men except for sculpture.
llm: In 2009 the Adult Education Centre offered a number of evening courses, and participation varied depending on the subject. The most popular courses for women were language courses with 120 participants, while the most popular course for men was practical work with 50 participants. The majority of the participants belonged to the age group between 25 and 44, so it seems that this group was the most interested in attending the courses. The age group from 45 to 64 constituted the second largest group with 30 participants, and the numbers of participants under 25 and over 65 were smaller with 10 and 5 respectively. The relatively small number of younger and older participants may be a sign that the center should consider changing its programs or marketing strategy in order to attract this group. It also seems that more courses should be offered for men, given the relatively high interest in practical work and computers. The data in this report provides an insight into the center’s audience, and it can be used to guide the planning of future courses in order to provide the community with a better service.

question: The bar chart below shows the percentage of unemployed graduates, aged 20-24, in one European country over a two-year period.Summarise the information by selecting and reporting the main features, and making comparisons where relevant.
human: The bar chart demonstrates the unemployed graduates who are between 20 and 24 years old by gender in percentage. The survey is conducted in one European country from 2008 to 2009.In general, the unemployment rates in males over a two-year period were higher than the females. The highest rate of unemployment in males was approximately 22% in Oct 2009, reaching nearly 40% more than females. Whereas the unemployment for female graduates in percentage was 6% reported in Apr 08, July 08 and Apr 09 which were the lowest rate of unemployment for graduates over the period.First of all, there was a slight decline in the unemployment rates for all graduates in the beginning of year, from 10% in Jan 08 to 7% in Apr 08 in males whilst female graduates decreasing from 7.5% to 6% . The unemployment for both genders in July 2008 remained same rates as previous. An increase in percentage of unemployed graduates in Oct 08 took nearly twofold of last month with males by 16% and females by 11%. Subsequently, a fall in the unemployment rates for all graduates were recorded in Jan 09, by 12.5% in men and 8% in women. question: The best way to reduce the number of traffic accidents is to raise age limit for the younger drivers and to lower age limit for the aged ones. Do you agree?
human: With the rapid increase in the number of vehicles on the with hush and rush lifestyles of drivers today, traffic accidents seem to be escalating in our society. partly to number of traffic accidents but surely not as the main factor.Those who agree with would view young drivers assuming under 18 years old and older drivers to be reckless and therefore would be more prone to traffic accidents on the road. Lack of experience, forgetfulness, carelessness and poor fitness condition may be reasons for limiting age of drivers.On the other hand, I would think that age is only a small determinant and we need to look at more effective measure such as reducing number of vehicles on the road through car pool, implementing more stringent regulations on alcohol drink driving and possibly to revise on the standard of driving test for young and old drivers on the road. Many drivers who are stuck in traffic jams also have busy lifestyles and therefore tend to become very stressed or distracted on the road. Thus I would think the government may have to look ways to improve road infrastructure and traffic jams to deter or reduce accidents on the road.To sum up, age is only one of the many contributors for accidents but I do not agree that age for the elderly and raising age limit for the younger drivers is the best method. As mentioned in my third paragraph, we need to look at other more effective measures which deal with the underlying problems in the society which lead to traffic accidents.
llm: I strongly disagree with this view. I do not think that increasing the age limit for younger drivers will necessarily reduce the number of accidents. It is obvious that this view shows a lack of understanding of the causes of accidents. Younger drivers are more prone to accidents because of their lack of experience and at times their recklessness. But instead of increasing the age limit, we should train them better to drive and instill in them a sense of responsibility. As for lowering the age limit for the aged, I believe that it is not only impractical but also dangerous. As one grows older, one’s reflexes slow down, one’s eyesight diminishes, one’s physical and mental condition deteriorates, and it is quite likely that their ability to drive will be impaired and the chances of accidents are increased. Better to reduce the number of accidents by a combination of measures like improved driver training, stricter traffic regulations, better road and vehicle construction, and an increased awareness of the importance of following safety regulations will have a greater impact on accident figures than just lowering the age limit. In my opinion, instead of lowering the age limit, the government should do regular medical check-ups of the aged drivers to ensure that they are still capable of driving. I believe that to reduce the number of accidents, a combination of measures rather than just a lowering or raising of age limits is necessary.

question: The best way to reduce the number of traffic accidents is to raise the age limit for younger drivers and to lower the age limit for aged drivers. Do you agree ?
human: Traffic accidents are on the rise these days. Most of the accidents injuries or death. Research have found that most of the accidents are caused by inexperienced drivers, for example young drivers.Young drivers tend to be more daring and are unable to avoid a crush when they face one. They tend to be more daring after drinking alcohol at night and this causes them to lose control of the car. Drunk driving will not only risk a person’s own life but may also cause an life to be lost.The government should encourage the driving to conduct driving lessons for drivers for a longer period. This will give them a clear picture about how accidents happen and teach them about the safety of others on the road. Drivers that have been in an accident after drunk driving should be from driving for at least two years and be given driving lessons again.However, for the aged drivers, the government should not only the age limit but also check the capability of the aged drivers for instance eyesight, hearing and other related health conditions to ensure safe driving. It does not mean that an aged person not fit to drive and has a problem with the heart but a young or a middle aged person could also have heart failure these days.To conclude, I feel that to raise the of young drivers not the best solution but to about the problems they may encounter on the road and to ban them from driving if they have caused an accident due to carelessness. As for the drivers, as long as they are capable on the road before a certain age and there are no health issues there shouldn’t be a problem.
llm: I strongly disagree with the proposition that the best way to reduce the number of traffic accidents is to raise the age limit for younger drivers and to lower the age limit for older drivers. Raising the age limit for younger drivers would restrict the freedom and mobility of young people, especially in remote areas where public transportation is in short supply. This would not only be impractical but would be unfair to young and old drivers. Besides, lowering the age limit for older drivers would not solve the problem either. Many young people are unable to find a way to school, work or other essential places of business without the help of their own transportation. In fact, studies have shown that the older a driver is, the more likely he is to be involved in an accident because of his physical and mental limitations. It is more sensible to have regular vision and driving tests to ensure that old drivers are still safe and capable of driving. We should focus on implementing safety measures that have been proven to be effective, such as graduated driver licenses for young people and regular tests for older drivers, in order to reduce the number of accidents involving both groups. Raising the age limit for young drivers and lowering the age limit for old drivers would not be an effective and sensible way to reduce the number of traffic accidents.

question: The best way to teach children to cooperate is through team sports at school. To what extent do you agree or disagree?
human: These days it is firmly believed that the most efficient method to teach children in schools how to work together is through team sports. This essay disagrees with the statement since some young students might not enjoy playing sports and because team sports can raise competitiveness amongst children, hence having a negative impact on their friendly relationships.First of all, although it is vital for a children to play sports and keep fit, not everyone is keen on football, rugby and volleyball. Instead, some young students prefer spending their leisure time on other activities such as joining a chorus group or teathre lessons. These activities can encourage cooperation and make children get along with each other, as well. On the other hand, forcing children to play something they doesn't feel comfortable in can make them withdraw from the team game, which would make them feel excluded.In addition, teams sports do not always promote cooperation among players. In some cases, inequities or particularly ambitious behaviours can lead to violent competitiveness, instead. It is generally thought that sport is an extremely selective environment, in fact you need to exercise daily in order to keep fit. If obese children took part in those team sports as well, they could feel isolated because they do not own the perfect body to perform well.In conclusion, although team sports are a great method to teach children how to get along with each other, there are various activities which can encourage cooperation among children, as well. Therefore, it is considerably significant for a school to embrace diversity and make children play with what they really like, instead of forcing them to do something they feel they don't belong.
llm: Firstly, I agree that team sports can be a very important opportunity for children to learn to cooperate, but I do not completely agree that it is the best way to teach them this important skill. Although team sports such as soccer, hockey, and hockey are the most popular among children, they teach children to learn discipline, work hard and teamwork, which are essential to success in all fields. The common goal they pursue helps them develop the ability to communicate, to respect and to trust each other. These sports also encourage children to work together, share ideas and learn from each other. However, I believe that teamwork can also be taught and learned in other ways. In addition, not all children are interested or talented in sports and therefore do not benefit from this teaching. In conclusion, I believe that school sports are not the only way to teach children to cooperate and that there are other approaches to teaching cooperation. It is important that children are given opportunities to work together, share ideas and learn from each other, regardless of the circumstances. A well-balanced education with different teaching methods will help children develop this important life skill and prepare them for the future.

The conclusions of the above study indicate the need for better water management, treatment and distribution worldwide. In addition, the considerable difference between the amount of water supplied to the two regions shows the need for a better global water distribution and resource allocation. The goal is to reach a future where all regions have access to a sufficient and sustainable water supply.

question: The charts shows air pollution levels by different causes among four countries in 2021.Summaries the information by selecting and reporting the main features, and make comparisons where relevant.
human: The bar chart illustrates the level of air pollution caused by three different sectors namely electricity generation, transport and industry among four countries which are China, America, Japan and Australia in 2021.Overall, it can be seen that China produced the highest amount of the pollution in every sector. Another noticeable point is that all causes in Australia created the pollution at almost the same amount.Looking at the detail, the industry, the transportation and the electricity generation in China generated the pollution level of 80, 70 and a little less than 60 ppm respectively. This pattern also occurred in Japan where the industry ranked first in releasing the pollution (above 40 ppm) and the power generation ranked last (produced around 15 ppm).Furthermore, approximately 60 ppm of the pollution in Australia is arisen from the electricity generation and the industry. This generated pollution of each aforementioned factors accounted for about 30 ppm which is nearly two times less than that of the transport. Focusing further on Australia, all three businesses created the pollution of just below 20 ppm.
llm: Industrial sources are the main cause of air pollution in three of the four countries. However, it is waste management that is the main source of air pollution in all four countries. Vehicle exhaust is also a major source of air pollution, especially in Country C, where it is responsible for nearly 30% of all pollution. By contrast, industrial activity in Country D is responsible for only about 20% of its air pollution. Waste management is also responsible for about 20% of all air pollution in Country B, which is higher than in the other three countries. Vehicle exhaust is also the main cause of air pollution in Country A, where it accounts for about 15% of all air pollution, and in Country C, it accounts for more than in Country A. In Country B and Country D, vehicle exhaust is responsible for less than 10% and 5% respectively of all air pollution. By comparison, waste management and vehicle exhaust are responsible for a smaller proportion of air pollution than industrial activity in three of the four countries, with Country C being the exception. Its high percentage of vehicle exhaust pollution indicates that stricter regulations or increased investment in vehicle-emission reduction may be needed. Waste management is responsible for a smaller proportion of air pollution in Country A, Country C and Country D, ranging from 5% to 10% of all air pollution. These figures indicate that it is important to develop a targeted approach to reducing air pollution, taking into account the particular causes of air pollution in each country. In contrast, the low level of industrial air pollution in Country D suggests that the regulation of industrial production or the implementation of cleaner production methods may have reduced the level of industrial air pollution.

question: The climograph below shows average monthly temperatures and rainfall in the city of Kolkata.Summarise the information by selecting and reporting the main features and make comparisons where relevant.
human: The graphic gives information about Kolkata's monthly temperatures and rainfall. There is a big discrepancy in the rainfall over the year, and summer months are those in which it rains the most. By contrast, the temperature is almost stable over the months although May is the hottest.There is a huge discrepancy in the rainfall over the year. There are months in which the millimeters of precipitation are higher and others in which they are almost zero. During the first three months of the year there are few precipitations. The rainfalls start sligtly to increase and, In particular, during the summer, from June to Septemper, it rains in large quantities. In July and August the millimeters of precipitation are almost 350. Instead, the colder months are less rainy. The millimiters of precipitations start decrease after August and they plummet down at the end of September. Indeed, the rainfall are almost zero from November to Jenuary.The temperature is almost stable during the year. It is never cold in Kolkata, rather the temperature is always around 20 C. May is the warmer month and the temperature exceeds 30C. By contrast, December and Jenuary are the coldest, although there are around 20C. The temerature start to go up in February whereas around August a decreasment is registered.
llm: The climograph shows that the city experiences a high temperature throughout the year with an average of 17 °C. As for rainfall, the climograph shows that there are seasonal changes. The city receives the highest rainfall between June and September. The month of July receives the most rainfall, an average of 300 mm, whereas the months of December, January and February receive very little. The hottest month is May with an average temperature of 30°C and the coldest month is January with an average temperature of 17°C. The climograph illustrates the characteristic tropical monsoon climate of the city. When one compares the temperature and the rainfall, it can be seen that the higher temperatures are associated with the monsoon season which brings considerable relief from the heat in the form of rain. The lower temperatures, on the other hand, are associated with the dry winter season when there is very little rain. Considering the considerable seasonal variation in temperature and rainfall, it is very important for the city’s economy, agriculture and daily life to understand these patterns and to adapt to them.

question: The dangers of smoking are well known, yet many people continue with this habit.What are the causes of this? How can we reduce smoking in society?Give reasons for your answer, and include any relevant examples from your own knowledge or experience.
human: It is very easy to find someone who smokes in today's society. Even though we were taught that smoke is harmful, we see people exhaling this thick fog everyday partly because some people think that it is cool and it can be purchased almost at every store. This essay will discuss deeply about what causes people to smoke and how this issue can be alleviated.Firstly, part of the society believes that it is trendy to smoke. In many pop culture, such as songs, movies, and novels portray smoking possitively. A comedy show that I have seen illustrates one of the character that smokes to be more cool, giving this character an untouchable aura, whilst other characters that did not smoke seem tangible and therefore mundane. Furthermore, cigarettes are easily accessable in any store. A recent study proved that over 80% of those eager to smoke for the first time actually started this behavior because they can buy it from their local shops. The trend from pop culture and the convenience in accessing smoke adds up to the reasons why some people continues with this habit.I believe that there are solutions that can tackle and reduce smoking, beginning with medias should portray smoking to have consequences that are relatable. A movie I have seen showed the protagonist's constant need for cigarette throughout the show. However, in the end when he finally unites with his crush, he develops a severe disease, mainly from his smoking habits, in which he regretted in the end. This method of portraying people who smoke totally made my younger niece scared of smoking. In addition, government should control the accessibility of cigarettes. Policies that result and fewer stores being able to sell cigarettes and increasing tax pricing of smoke of any kind will definitely make smoking less convenient for many people.In conclusion, although many people knew how harmful smoking is, many people think it is cool to smoke and it is convenient and easy to buy. By making smoking less trendy in society and harder to access, I believe that smoking will be less attractive, hence reducing the number of smokers in society.
llm: Smoking, despite the well-known harmful effects, remains a common habit in our society. The causes of this persistence are many and varied. A significant factor is the lack of information and education about the dangers of smoking, especially among young people. One of the main reasons is the chemical addiction to nicotine that is difficult to break, accompanied by emotional and psychological addictions such as relieving stress or social contact, which also make it difficult to break this habit. Also, the aggressive advertising and lobbying of the tobacco industry have a part to play in the persistence of smoking. Young people start smoking often under peer pressure or because they believe smoking is a fashionable activity. The introduction of comprehensive education about smoking in schools would also prevent young people from starting smoking. To reduce smoking in society, governments and health authorities need to introduce stricter legislation and public health campaigns. In the end, a combination of these measures, in combination with easy access to information and support services for people who want to stop smoking, will reduce smoking in society and lead to a healthier society. Smoke-free laws, such as those that exist in many countries, also help to denormalize smoking and protect non-smokers from second-hand smoke.

question: The diagram below show the development of the horse over a period of 40 million years. The evolution of the horse, with particular emphasis on the changing foot structure.Write a report for a university lecturer describing the information shown below.
human: The diagram illustrates the evolution of the horse in terms of their foot structure over a 40 million year period. Overall, the horse's were divided into four stages of development, starting from a period of 40 million years ago until now, with a 10 to 15 million year gap approximation in between.To begin with, 40 million years ago, the Eohippus, which was the first developmental stage of a horse's foot structure was similar to the bone structure of a human's hand. However, they branch out into five toes while travelling on foot. Then, during stage 2 of the horse's foot development, which was 10 million years later, the horse evolved into a Mesohippus. With regards to the structure of its toe, it was reduced from the original five into three. In addition, the middle toe had a larger foot structure compared to other other two.Next, 15 million years later, came the evolution of a Merychippus from a Mesohippus. Similarly, the foot structure was identical to the Mesohippus' horse but did not have the middle toe's length significantly longer than the other two. Although the middle toe was thicker than before, it became more even in terms of its length comparison to its other two toes. Finally, the emergence of the final evolution of the horse in modern days. With regards to the foot structure, it no longer branched out into several toes as it used to be, but is shaped like a tree branch with a rounded bases on the bottom of the foot.
llm: The development of the horse is an interesting example of the evolution of adaptation. The changes in the structure of the horse's foot over a period of forty million years are clearly shown in the diagram. These changes arose as the environment changed from the forests to the open plains. The number of toes gradually decreased, as shown in the diagram, to three toes, as in Merychippus, and then to the hoof of the modern horse, Equus. These early horses were small animals that lived in the forests, and probably used their many toes to gain support and balance in the uneven ground. The most important change, however, occurred when the hoof developed to its present form, enabling the horse to cover the open plains at speed. The toes became thicker and more robust and were specialized for the absorbing of shocks and the lifting of the body. This transition is an example of the power of natural selection, which adapted the structure of the horse to the changing environment, producing one of the most enduring and recognizable species in the world. In conclusion, the diagram shows the development of the foot structure over a period of forty million years, starting from many-toed and flexible feet, to the specialized single-toed foot of the modern horse.

question: The diagram below shows how Olive Oil is manufactured.Write a report for a university lecturer describing the information below.
human: The Olive Oil is manufactured through several ways. First of all, the olives are picked from the trees by the farmers. Then the fresh olives are rinished using the cold water. The machines used are specific and it helps belt to smash the olives. After smashed, the olives become either olive paster or the olive stones. The next step is to put those into a bag with holes. Moving onto the next step, it will be pressed by a certain pressurer. It gives a great amount of weight on the olives so that it can be well pressed. Moreover it will be separated into either oil or water. Then, it will be stored and sold to the consumers. Thus, it is quite apparent that olive oil is manufactured by specific steps. And so more, olive oil is widely used as it is a good source for the chefs when cooking.
llm: The production of olive oil goes through several stages from harvesting to packaging. Unfortunately, the diagram is not included here, but I will outline the production of olive oil in general terms. After the olives are harvested, they are sorted and cleaned, then they are crushed or squeezed, usually in a stone mill or a modern machine. The olives are then dried in the sun. The oily liquid is transferred to a malaxer, a special tank where the oil separates from the pulp. Then the oil is transferred to a centrifuge, where the solids and water are separated from the oil. Oil is then filtered and put into bottles or containers and sent to the shops. Some oil producers filter the oil to remove all impurities, while others leave it unfiltered to retain all its flavour and nutrients. As a university lecturer, you will be interested to know that the quality of the oil depends a lot on the method of production. Many producers use more modern and effective methods to improve yield and quality. In conclusion, the manufacture of olive oil is a multi-stage process, and each stage of it, from harvesting to packaging, determines the quality of the oil.

question: The diagram below shows how avocado oil is extracted.Summarise the information by selecting and reporting the main features, and make comparisons where relevant. You should write at least 150 words.
human: The two images presented give information regarding the gender and age of attenders of some eductional courses in 2009.Overall, with the exception of sculpture courses, female is the dominant gender among the people who attended these evening courses. llm: The extraction of oil from avocados involves several stages. The first step is to wash the fruit, then to remove the peel and pit. The main feature of the process is the cold-press method, which is similar to the one used for olives. It is very important for the quality of the oil produced, as higher temperatures destroy the oil’s nutrients and flavour. The flesh of the fruit is mixed with water to make a paste. This is heated to a low temperature in order to extract the oil. Then the paste is transferred to a centrifuge in order to separate the oil from the paste. The extraction of oil from the pulp of an avocado yields a lower yield than other oil-extracting methods, and therefore the price is higher than that of other oils. However, this is compensated by the oil’s high nutritional value and its particular flavour, which make it popular with consumers and chefs who are interested in healthy eating. In conclusion, the diagram shows the care and consideration involved in extracting the oil from an avocado, which sets it apart from other methods of extracting oil. The cold-press method preserves the oil’s natural vitamins and anti-oxidants, which makes it a desirable oil for those looking for a high-quality oil that is full of nutrients.

question: The diagram below shows how coffee is produced and prepared for sale in supermarkets and shops.Summarise the information by selecting and reporting the main features and make comparisons where relevant.
human: The diagram shows the process of coffee from production to preparing for sale in supermarkets and shops.Overall, it is certain that coffee goes through 11 different stages from picking the beans to packing in jars.Firstly, coffee beans are picked and then dried by humans. The dried beans are later roasted in a machine then in the blast freezer machine, it's cooled down rapidly. Furthermore, after cooling out they go through a grinding process where they turned into powder, then mixed with high-temperature water after a while, it goes from straining process.We are now arriving at the later process where coffee is now frozen in the refrigerator. In the third last stage, again it goes from the grinding process but this time it is frozen and after this, they put them in a vacuum machine where it evaporates the water from coffee to make them dry.Lastly, the coffee is ready to pack in the jar and ready to sell on the market.
llm: The journey of the coffee begins with the sowing, when the coffee seeds are planted in the nursery. After three or four months the seedlings are moved to the plantation, where they are grown for three to three and a half years. Then the coffee beans go through a fermentation process which dissolves the mucilage, a sticky substance that covers the beans. After the harvesting, the coffee cherries go through a pulping process which removes the skin and seeds. Then the beans are dried, either by the sun or in machines. Once the beans are dry, they are hulled to remove the parchment, leaving only the green coffee bean. Then the coffee beans are sorted according to size and quality, then roasted to develop the flavour and aroma, and finally packed for transport to shops and supermarkets. There are also some coffee beans that go through an additional process of being ground before being packed, especially those that are to be used in instant coffee. All in all, the production and preparation of coffee for sale in shops and supermarkets is a complex and long process, requiring great care and attention to produce a high quality product. Compared to other food and drink production, coffee production is a relatively long and laborious process, especially in the early stages, but the result is a high-quality product with a unique flavour and aroma.

question: The diagram below shows how ethanol fuel is produced from corn.Summarise the information by selecting and reporting the main features and make comparisons where relevant.
human: The diagram illustrates that the process of corn which is formed into ethanol fuel with various kinds of steps from the starting point of Corn to the lasting point of Transporting.Overall, there are 3 main steps of processing from the beginning to the end. In the fourth section and sixth section, adding water and liquid is the most important part of these formed of fuel.On the first step, the corn will be stored and milling to be reached to cooking. It will need 4 hours times to be cooked and water would be added into the cooking. On the second, Fermenting will be hold on (48 hours) after the cooking levels of speed. Then, the separating time has arrived, within this process the liquid is then added into the solids of separating product.In the final steps, after (5 hours) time of mixing purifying ethanol will be get its point. Taking ethanol has stored after its purifying steps and then transporting in the surface area to get to ethanol fuel.
llm: A diagram of how a multi-step process it is to produce a bio-fuel from corn is shown. It all starts with the cleaning of the corn and then it is ground into a flour. The flour is mixed with water to make a mash which is then heated to break down the starches into sugars. Yeast is then added to the mash which is fermented over two or three days. The resulting mixture is cooled and then transferred to a fermentation tank where yeast converts the sugar into ethanol. A by-product of the process is the distiller’s grains which can be used as animal feed. The process of making ethanol from corn has several advantages over other methods of producing bio-fuels. It makes use of a widely available and renewable source which is used to replace fossil fuels. It also reduces food miles, which means less transport of food from farm to fork. However, the process of making ethanol from corn uses a large amount of energy to heat and distill the corn, which reduces some of the positive effect of using a bio-fuel. As the world seeks to find new sustainable sources of energy, a bio-fuel made from corn remains an important research area.

question: The diagram below shows how oil is expected in use of production of perfumeSummarise the information by selecting and reporting the main features, and make comparisons where relevant.
human: The given process chart illustrates how perfume is obtained using oil as an ingredient. Overall, the product undergoes 4 main steps, which involve prevalently water and the usage of heating and cooling down methods, in addition to a separation machine, before being ready to be used to create a fragrance.For starters, the water is placed in a metal tank and brought to the boiling point through direct flames. Then, the steam is conducted by a pipe to another cistern, where aromatic plants are added, in order to obtain oil vapor mixed with steam.Right afterward, the mixture goes into a pipe system, where a condensation process takes place, thanks to a condenser that uses cold water. In doing so, the cold water flowing in the condenser absorbs the heat that comes from the pipe where the oil and water solution is. After that, water mixed with essential oil reaches the last tank, in which a separator proceeds to take essential oil apart. This way, only the aromatic water is able to proceed and it is possible to use it in the perfume industry.
llm: The process starts with growing flowers, herbs and spices rich in aromatic oil. The main features of the process involve several main stages. They are harvested and then transported to an oil extraction plant, where the oil is extracted using either a steam distillation process or a solvent extraction process. Steam distillation is the older method of oil extraction, where high temperatures are used to extract the oils from the plant material. Afterwards, the extracted oil is collected and filtered, and the filtered oil is then mixed with other essential oils and aromatic compounds to produce the desired fragrance. According to the method used, the more refined and complex scents from steam distillation are preferred over those from solvent extraction. Compared to other methods of producing perfume, oil extraction produces a more natural and high quality product. This mixture is then stored for a while to allow the different fragrances to mature and stabilize. In conclusion, the diagram shows that the production of perfume from oil extraction involves a number of different stages, from the growing of the plants to the blending and maturing of the oil. However, the solvent extraction method can be more efficient and cost-effective for certain plants. Oil extraction plays a vital role in producing unique and high quality perfumes.

question: The diagram below shows how rain water is collected and then treated to be used as drinking water in an Australian town. Summarise the information by selecting and reporting the main features and make comparisons where relevant.You should write at least 150 words.
human: Information is presented in a diagram which depicts the main steps of rainwater treatment with the aim to produce drinking water in a particular town in Australia.Overall, it can be clearly seen that the process involves a number of complex stages starting from collecting rainwater, purification until getting the water as a final product.At the beginning of the process, rainwater is drained from a roof through a tube which is attached to each house. Then the water flow through the tube to a three-layer water filter which is the first step of water purification. After that, the filtered water is kept in a storage tank which is connected to a water treatment tank. As the water in the storage flows into the water treatment tank, it is mixed with chemicals, making this step as the final part of the process. Once the water is mixed, it flows from the water treatment tank to each house and is ready for drinking.
llm: The diagram above shows the system for collecting rainwater in an Australian town. The rainwater is collected from rooftops and is pumped through a network of pipes to a large water tank, from where it is pumped to a water treatment plant. Here it undergoes a series of chemical processes to make it fit for human consumption. The first of these is filtration, which removes impurities from the water, making it clearer and more pleasant to drink. Then the water is disinfected using chlorine or an ultra violet light to kill any bacteria or viruses. The disinfection process is vital to make sure that the water is free from harmful microorganisms. Compared with the usual methods of treating water from the river or the sea, the use of rainwater is a more sustainable and environmentally friendly option. By collecting and treating rainwater the town saves ground water and reduces the impact on the local environment. Moreover, the use of rainwater as a source of drinking water shows a commitment to sustainable water use and is an example to other towns. This system of collecting and treating rainwater in an Australian town shows a commitment to taking an innovative approach to water treatment. As rainwater requires less treatment than water from other sources, the energy needed to treat it is also reduced. The success of this method could inspire other towns, particularly those with a high rainfall, to collect and treat rainwater as a source of drinking water.

question: The diagram below shows how solar panels can be used to provide electricity for domestic use.Write a report for a university, lecturer describing the information shown below.
human: The diagram illustrates the production of electricity for domestic use by solar panels. Overall, electricity is provided after it has been processed using 5 equipments ( solar panels, inverter electrical panel, utility meter and utility grid).First of all, solar panels on the roof of a normal house receive and absorb energy from the sun and turn it into DC current. The second stage is that, the DC current is converted into AC current by using inverter, which controls the electricity and production. After that, once the solar electricity has been distributed to our homes, it is then flowed back to the grid through a utility meter.At the final stage of the process, a utility grid, which looks like a small electrical tower, provides electricity when an user uses extra amount than the amount produced by the solar panles. By these stages, electricity is produced and ready for domestic use.
llm: It is very simple. There is a photovoltaic cell on the panel, which is used to convert sunlight into electricity. Usually these cells are installed on the roof of the house, where they receive full sunlight during the day. Then, through a wire, the generated electricity is transmitted to the charge controller. The charge controller controls the electricity produced by the battery. The batteries store extra electricity generated during the day and use it at night and on cloudy days, which is then used to power all the appliances in the house. The diagram also shows a connection to the electricity network that the household can use when the sun does not produce enough electricity. Energy stored in the battery is then converted to alternating current (AC) by the inverter. The AC electricity is then distributed through the house through the circuit breaker, which ensures safe and reliable connection to the sockets and lights. In short, this diagram gives a full picture of a solar system that is used to produce electricity for domestic use. The system collects sunlight, stores extra energy and distributes it throughout the house, as well as using the electricity network to get extra energy when needed. At the same time, it can send extra energy to the network and sell it to the electricity company, which will earn an extra income for the household. These types of renewable energy systems are an attractive option for households looking to reduce their carbon footprint.

question: The diagram below shows the development of cutting tools in the Stone Age. Summarise the information by selecting and reporting the main features and make comparisons where relevant.You should write at least 150 words.
human: The diagram indicates the development of two cutting tools (Tool A and Tool B) in the Stone Age, from a front view, side view and back view. Tool A is a tool of 1.4 million years ago, whereas, Tool B is a cutting tool of 0.8 million years ago.Overall, Toll A and B were bigger than 5 cm long, were made of stone and were used in the Stone Age as cutting tools. Tool A had a triangular form, whilst, Tool B had a more complex form which is similar to a pentagon.In detail, the front view of Tool A seems rougher and with less sharpness than Tool B. Regarding the side view, the diagram shows that Tool A was wider than Tool B. Finally, the back view of Tool A shows that this device was thinner than Tool B's back view.To sum it up, these two cutting tools were similar in material and length. However, Tool B seems that it was a more developed tool, which was thinner in the side view and with a more complex form in its front and back view than Tool A.
llm: The development of cutting tools in the Stone Age shows a gradual development from simple to more complex tools. The Oldowan tools about 2,5 million years ago are simple, rough tools consisting of sharp stone edges used for the most basic tasks such as cutting and chopping. About 1,7 million years ago, the Acheulean tools appear, symmetrical, finely-crafted tools. These are used for a wider range of tasks, such as butchery and carving. The middle Paleolithic, from about 300,000 to 50,000 years ago, is characterised by the appearance of the Levalloisian and Mousterian tools. Comparison of these tools shows a gradual development from simple to more complex tools, and each period added to the knowledge of the preceding period, so that tools became more efficient, varied and precise. These tools are more standardized and specialised, especially stone and flint points, which are used for hunting and working hides. In the Upper Paleolithic, from about 50,000 to 10,000 years ago, the tools were even more refined, lighter and more efficient, enabling a wider range of subsistence strategies. Generally, the development of cutting tools in the Stone Age represents a narrative of slow, gradual innovation, which has been crucial to the survival and development of human societies. This process highlights the ingenuity and adaptability of early humans, who have adapted to their environment by developing their technological skills and are still learning to exploit available resources.

question: The diagram below shows the development of cutting tools in the Stone Age. Summarize the information by selecting and reporting the main features, and make comparisons where relevant.You should write at least 150 words.

llm: For example: “The earliest stage in the development of cutting tools, the Paleolithic period, generally known as the stone age, was characterized by the use of primitive tools such as hammers, axes, and chisels. These simple tools, made of stone and wood, were used primarily for purposes such as cutting, grinding, and pounding. Often several stones were combined to make composite tools, showing the resourcefulness and resourcefulness of early humans in making tools. As time went on, the tools became more sophisticated and the microlith, a small, symmetrical stone tool, marked a turning point. The microlith was a major advance in the toolmaking process. The polished axe could cut through wood more easily and the scythe, with its serrated blade, was particularly useful in harvesting, marking the beginning of the Neolithic age, the period of a more organized agriculture. From the use of cutting tools in the Stone Age, we can see not only the gradual development of human technology, but also the changes in the needs and customs of early human society, from the need to survive to the more organized farming system. From the changes in material, we can see that the use of rough, unpolished stone has gradually changed to polished and sanded stone, which reflects the increasing knowledge of material properties and the possibilities of using them. Through the use of cutting tools, we can see human ingenuity, the foundation of the development of technology, and the significance of innovation in social development.

question: The diagram below shows the life cycle of a salmon, from egg to adult fish.Summarise the information by selecting and reporting the main features and make comparisons where relevant.
human: The diagram depicts the life-cycle of the salmon, from being an egg to transforming into a fully grown adult fish.The first stage of the salmon starts in the river, where the spawning of two mature salmons lead to the laying of eggs. The rivers have long been chosen by salmons for breeding spots because their fresh-saltless water is suitable for the eggs and the freshly hatched baby salmons to start maturing in. After emerging from the eggs, the hatchlings stay on in the fresh water till they pre-mature/partially grow. After gaining considerable size and adapting to the primary waters, they travel to the estuaries, the only stop-over between them and the oceans. Only the first of the young salmons to reach the estuaries are able to make it to the oceans. This is because once these small and stagnant water bodies get over-crowded, there is virtually no space left in them which in-turn leads to the death of many young salmons.The young salmons who were able to survive the estuaries journey to the oceans, where the salty water increases their size and makes them fully grown. After getting the maturity to breed, they go back to the rivers from where the cycle starts all-over again.In total, there are 8 stages in the life of a salmon to maturity, it starts in the rivers and ends in the rivers too.
llm: The life cycle of the salmon is complex and involves a great deal of migration. The life cycle begins with the eggs, which are laid by adult females in the gravel of freshwater rivers. After the eggs are fertilized, they develop into embryos, which feed on their yolk sac. The fry then become larger and feed on small insects and plankton. As they grow, the salmon swim downriver and reach the estuaries, where they acclimatize to the saltwater. The salmon is unusual in that it migrates from the sea to fresh water to spawn. The life cycle is completed in the ocean, where the salmon become adults and feed on a variety of prey, including other fish, crustaceans and squid. In summary, the diagram clearly and accurately shows the life cycle of the salmon and explains the different stages. In comparison to other fish, the life cycle of the salmon is particularly long and complex, with some species migrating over ten thousand kilometers.

question: The diagram below shows the life cycle of the honey bee.Write a report for a university, lecturer describing the information shown below.
human: Overall the cycle of life of the honey bee can be divided in 6 steps which can be grouped in 2 main stages: hatching and reaching for maturity. This process lasts around 34 to 36 days and it repeats itself over again.The cycle starts when female bees lay their eggs. They lay their eggs rapidly but surely at around 1 or 2 eggs every 3 days. Subsequently the hatching of the eggs happens after 9 to 10 days.Afterwards the nymph molts begin to come out of the eggs and keep on gradually growing up until the 7th day of the cycle. During their 9th day, the bees grow 3 times their initial size. Following this, the young adult emerges. The final step occurs after 4 days when the bee reaches its maturity and females are ready to lay eggs again. Making the cycle begin again from the laying of the eggs.
llm: The honey bee life cycle is complex and highly organized. The honey bee is an example of a symbiosis. The life cycle begins with an egg, which the queen lays in the cell of the honeycomb. The eggs hatch in 3 to 4 days, the larval stage lasts for 5 to 6 days. The larval stage is followed by the pupal stage, which lasts from 7 to 23 days depending on the caste. During this time the larvae are fed royal jelly and pollen by the worker bees and develop. This is the last stage in the life cycle. The adult bees hatch from the cells and start their lives in the colony. The queen can live for five years and is responsible for laying eggs, the survival of the colony and the production of the queen. The worker bees are all females and can live for a month or two during the summer and are responsible for defending the colony, collecting food and the general care of the colony. The diagram shows clearly the different roles and life spans of each caste and the organization and cooperation of the castes in the colony. It is obvious that the survival of the colony depends on the successful progression through the stages and on the division of labor. The drones are males, have a short lifespan and have only one purpose: to mate with the queen. As a university student, I find that it is obvious that it would be of great benefit to study this life cycle in order to understand the biology and behavior of these important pollinators. In conclusion, the honey bee life cycle is a complex and fascinating process that is vital for the survival and success of the colony.

question: The diagram below shows the production of olive oil. Summarise the information by selecting and reporting the main features, and make comparisons where relevant.You should write at least 150 words.
human: This illust displays all the procedures by which olive oil is produced from olives. There is a total of seven steps where the initial step is to pick some olives, and the final step is to extract only olive oil from pressed olive paste.To put into detail, obtaining enough amounts of olive is the starting process. Picked olives are rinsed in cold water. After that, rinsed olives are delivered into a smashing machine through belts. This machine enables olives to divide into olive paste and olive stones. Thereafter, only olive paste is put into hollow bags and carried into the pressing process. Olive paste inside the bag is pressed and further move into separating process. A portion of olive oil is completely removed from the rest of water portion. Finally, extracted olive oil is delivered to storages and on the market if necessarily. This is the complete process of olive oil production.

First, the olives are washed to remove dirt and leaves, then they are crushed to release the oil by using a metal grinder. The resulting mixture is then mixed and left to stand for some time to allow the oil to separate from the solid matter. The oil is then transferred to storage tanks for further clarification. The final product is then checked for quality and bottled or put into containers ready for distribution. In general, the production of olive oil involves many painstaking steps to ensure that the finished product is of the best possible quality. Compared to the production of other edible oils, such as seed oil, olive oil is produced in smaller quantities but at a much higher value, because of its distinctive flavour and health benefits.

question: The diagram gives information about the process of making carbonated drinks.Summarise the information by selecting and report in the main features, and make comparisons where relevant.

question: The diagram shows the components of a neuron and how it worksWrite a report for a university, lecturer describing the information shown below.
human: The diagram below identifies the role of each neuronal components and illustrates the message transmission process happening in a neuron.The main component of a neuron is the cell body or soma. From its core branches out many small nerves called dendrites with the role of receving messages from other cells. The acquired messages are passed away from the cell body to other neurons, muscles or glands through a chain of axon. Each axon is coverred by a small element called myelin sheath that helps speed up the neural impulses.The message transmission process is conducted by continous actions of each component. After the dendrites receive information, the cell body will trigger an electrical signal traveling down the axon chain carrying these messages to a destination consisting of a network off terminal buttons. Each button form junction with other dendrite other cells to connect the messages. After all, all neuron are connected to form a network.
llm: The neuron, also called the nerve cell, consists of several elements that work together to transport and process information. The center of the neuron is the cell body, also known as the soma, which contains the nucleus and is responsible for the synthesis of proteins and the maintenance of the entire cell. The axon is divided into the axon hillock, the initial segment and the terminals. The dendrites, branched extensions of the cell body, receive impulses from other nerve cells and the axon, a long, thin filament, which carries the impulse away from the cell body, extend from the cell body. When the axon terminals receive an action potential, they produce a release of chemical messengers that act on the axon terminals of neighboring cells. This releases an action potential in the neighboring cell, which then triggers the process and the information is transmitted to other parts of the nervous system. The axon terminals, which are located at the end of the axon, are responsible for the release of chemical messengers into the synaptic gap, which separates two nerve cells. The intricate way in which nerve impulses are sent and received is an example of the complexity of the human nervous system. It is therefore important to understand the structure and function of the neuron in order to understand the complexity of the nervous system, which makes it possible for the body to respond to stimuli, control movement and think.

question: The diagram shows the design of a modern landfill for household waste. Summarize the information by selecting and reporting the main features and make comparisons where relevant.You should write at least 150 words.
human: These illustration graphs explain the process of how a modern landfill for domestic waste is created.There are three sective of entire process, including construction, which could be divided into two steps, followed by the section of the use and the final part which is the closure.Start with the construction by createing an artificial deep hole, which surrounded by the natural rocks. Four drainage pipes are settled parallelly and all connected with a main pipe reach out the hole.After the preparation is completed, it comse with the official use. Set the domestic trash inside the hole, which allows the waste liguid draning in the ground through the clay. The last part is closure, which the holw will be coved with clay, which the gases produced along the process will be outputted through the pipes connect to outer place.
llm: - The diagram of a modern household waste dump shows a comprehensive design that puts the emphasis on the environment and efficiency. The main feature is the use of a liner at the bottom of the heap, which prevents the leakage of toxic substances into the groundwater, a major improvement on the old dumps, where the water was often contaminated. The heap is covered with soil to reduce odors and fewer insects, and this system also collects methane, a greenhouse gas produced by decomposition. The methane can be collected and used as a source of renewable energy, thus reducing the carbon footprint of the dump. The dump is also equipped with a leaching system, which collects and treats liquid waste from decomposed material, which also prevents the leakage of contaminated water, a common problem with less modern dumps. In comparison to older landfills, where methane was simply let out into the atmosphere, this significantly reduces the environment's impact. And compared to older systems, where a big hole in the ground was used as a garbage dump without taking into account the environment, the new concept represents a major advancement. The modern dump combines waste disposal with energy production and a thorough disinfection, and thus represents a sustainable solution for household waste. The design also includes a gas collection system, where decomposition gases are collected efficiently and used for energy production. The system reflects a move towards a more responsible waste management policy, which minimizes the negative effects on the environment while maximizing resource recovery.

question: The diagram shows the production of circuit boards.Summarise the information by selecting and reporting the main features, and make comparisons where relevant.
human: The flow chart sheds light on how circuit boards are produced.Overall, the chart presents a multi-phase process that starts with the delivery of raw materials and ends with final products being delivered to factories.When the raw materials are delivered to circuit-board producers, they will be cut and sprayed with fire retardant, and experience the cleaning process. Following the IC attachment and soldering, there will be two stages of quality oversight, including visual inspection and quality control testing and final testing. If each of the inspection stages identifies any substandard products, the chips from such rejected products will be discarded. On the contrary, the products that pass the inspection process will be packaged and then sent to relevant users.To draw a conclusion, the production of circuit boards consists of a few stages, such as cutting and spraying, IC attachment and soldering, quality supervision, etc.
llm: This diagram shows the process of making circuit boards, which involves a number of complicated steps that convert raw materials into functioning electronic components. First the copper-clad laminate is cut to the required size. This first step is important, as it determines the final dimensions and material. Next it is exposed to chemical etching and then the copper layer is partly removed to make the circuit paths, and the excess is removed to ensure high conductivity and electrical performance. After that the board is drilled to accommodate the components; this requires careful planning and must be accurate to ensure accurate placement of the components. Then it is coated with solder mask, and is printed with identifying marks and soldering pads to facilitate assembly. Finally it is tested and packed for shipment. This process combines mechanical and chemical steps to produce a very specialised and important component of modern electronics. Compared with traditional production methods, it requires a higher level of precision and a cleaner environment, since dust and other particles may be damaging to electronic components. question: The diagram shows the production of hydroelectricitySummarise the information by selecting and reporting the main features, and make comparisons where relevant.
human: The diagram displays the general principles of how electricity is generated in a dam. In general, to produce hydroenergy, there should be a difference in the level of water flowing through the turbine.The water is stored in the reservoir out of which it goes through the intake to the penstrock. The pens should be inclined. This means that its high point is in the intake and then it goes down to the turbine. The pressure, that the flow creates, makes the turbin roll and start the generator. Generator produces power that is supplied to the long distance power lines.Having passed throuth the turbine, water, in its turn, sharply goes down and falls into the river.As it can be seen from the diagram, the generator and long distance power lines are located on the ground while there parts of the dam, such as the intake, the penstock, and the turbine are all under the ground.
llm: Describe the sequence of the diagram: The process begins with the collection of water in a reservoir. A dam is built across a river to create the reservoir. The main feature of the process is the conversion of kinetic energy in flowing water into electrical energy. The flow of water from the reservoir is controlled by the inlet valve, which is then pushed through the penstock, a pipe which carries the water down to the turbine. The water then passes through the moving blades of the blades, which are connected to the generator, producing the electrical energy. The efficiency of this process is very high, and the efficiency of some plants reaches up to 95%. The energy is then transported to the national grid, where it is distributed to homes, businesses and industries. In comparison to other renewable energy sources such as solar or wind power, hydropower has the advantage of being more reliable. The efficiency of hydropower is significantly higher than the efficiency of the average fossil-fuel plant, which ranges from 33% to 50%. In addition, hydropower is a very reliable and environmentally friendly way of generating electricity. The water in the reservoir can be released as needed, ensuring a continuous supply of electricity.
